body:
Consider

```
def debug(fun):
    print(fun)
    return fun

class A(object):
    @staticmethod
    @debug
    def foo(self):
        return self
```

In Python, this correctly prints `<function foo at 0x7f4d305df410>`.
In Cython, this wrongly prints `<staticmethod object at 0x7f4d30e5e718>`.

When doing the same with a Cython `cdef class`, the decorators are somehow applied twice: the output becomes

```
<staticmethod object at 0x7f4d30e5eb40>
<staticmethod object at 0x7f4d305e52f0>
```

Migrated from http://trac.cython.org/ticket/880

comment_data.body:
> Working on this.

Not really, this is too hard for me.
"the decorators are somehow applied twice" is fixed by #1724.
See #1274 for the original ticket. Basically, your `A.b` should not be special cased as a `staticmethod` by Cython, whereas `A.a` should. For `A.b`, things should be left to the user entirely.

Just hit this same issue. In case there's an important nuance, I'll add my test case.

file: `static_cythonized.py`
```
import functools


class Foo:
    @staticmethod
    @functools.lru_cache(None)
    def bar():
        pass
```
`python -c 'from static_cythonized import Foo'` works fine

1. Compile the file with `cythonize static_cythonized.py -i -3`
2. Rerunning `python -c 'from static_cythonized import Foo'` will give this error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "static_cythonized.py", line 5, in init static_cythonized
    @functools.lru_cache(None)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/functools.py", line 480, in decorating_function
    wrapper = _lru_cache_wrapper(user_function, maxsize, typed, _CacheInfo)
TypeError: the first argument must be callable
```
Is there any update on this issue?
Using the deprecated `abstractstaticmethod` is a temp fix for now. Hoping the bug can be fixed soon.
Hoping this bug will be fixed soon, it's annoying.

FWIW there is a PR that should fix this issue https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3966 - testing that PR and letting me know whether it works or not for your would be useful. We don't really need more comments saying "I hope this is fixed soon" though.

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Combining @staticmethod with other decorators is broken
